item.title: Dulwich Wood Park SE19 re traffic going towards West, 29th December
item.description:
Dulwich Wood Park SE19 re traffic going towards West Norwood / Herne Hill direction. Between Baird Close junction (opposite side of the road) and Dulwich Wood Avenue for a long time close to the latter you have had a warning sign for a raised pedestrian crossing. Much closer to Baird Close junction you have installed a blue roundabout sign. This sign is about 100 yards from the roundabout yet in the Highway Code says this is an “Instruction” sign ie ‘give way to the right’ which you can’t do as there is no roundabout at this location. Please remove this confusing placed sign. I’d suggest you replace with a roundabout warning sign (ie triangle in shape with red boarder) and the offending sign you relocate at the roundabout just by Dulwich Wood Avenue junction. Google Streetview link: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4278409,-0.0840508,3a,75y,282.15h,89.22t/data=!3m8!1e1!3m6!1sK3vIzRT5BF7AqRjKDqhoow!2e0!5s20250601T000000!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D0.7845921936876437%26panoid%3DK3vIzRT5BF7AqRjKDqhoow%26yaw%3D282.15256257173644!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MTIwOS4wIKXMDSoKLDEwMDc5MjA2N0gBUAM%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hunters Meadow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bike dumped in the river in the park close to Bromley and Downham Youth Club. item.title: The street in front of 63 Tennyson Road, 29th December
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tennyson Road, London

item.title: Norman Park - Litter, 29th December
item.description:
Huge amount of litter needs clearing ASAP please: From grass area behind LBB bins; From grass verge/edge from LBB bins to the entrance to Norman Park Community Sports Centre. Whole area looks very neglected and unwelcoming currently - please can all litter be cleared ASAP. Thanks. I’m sharing a what3words address to help you find this specific location. item.title: Rubbish spilling onto the street, 29th December
item.description:
Due to the fact our black top bins have not been collected for 3 weeks now, all bins are overflowing and clearly foxes have got at some bags, meaning there is now rubbish on the pavements and road. I have tried reporting on Greenwich website, but it will not allow me to, telling me I cant raise a ticket.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Church Manorway, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Neighbors throwing liquid daily causing smell/gas, 29th December
item.description:
There is water in front of our apartment door all the time. I always find it there and there is no problem with the block itself. The water has a terrible smell and my son gets sick every week. We have been to the emergency room twice.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Portland Rise, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
